name: bunkhouse
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a simple building for people to sleep in, especially one with bunks (= beds placed one on top of the other): We camped overnight in a bunkhouse and sat around telling stories and drinking cups of tea. There were houses for the managers with families and bunkhouses for the single workers. The bunk houses and campsites in the area are good value.
More examplesFewer examplesBefore she came he had lived in a bunkhouse with the other single men.About thirty people live in a bunkhouse provided by the resort, while others sleep in trucks or tents.A bunkhouse stay will work very well for most skiers and boarders.
